extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 1.6: Why did England not participate in the early competition for New World colonies?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: POST 01 04

config.question: Which country had initially claimed the land that Roanoke was founded upon?

answer_3.response: In 1587, Raleigh dispatched colonists under the command of John White to Roanoke, a site on the coast of present-day North Carolina, but poor planning, preparation for war with Spain, and hostilities with Native Americans doomed the experiment. When English vessels finally returned to Roanoke, the settlers had disappeared.
